author: plasmapower
content: I wonder if for the test ceremony, there's a 5 minute timeout on contributions

author: plasmapower
content: there's code which prevents you from logging in if the sequencer is currently waiting for a contribution from you, which makes sense

author: plasmapower
content: so if the sequencer was still awaiting your contribution from the last ceremony, and the timeout was 5 minutes, then it'd give you "unknown session id" if you tried again with a new client

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
```
Response: {"code":"CeremonyError::PubKeyPairingFailed","error":"contribution invalid: Error in contribution 0: Pubkey pairing check failed"}
```
Yay one step further

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: For updating the potPubKey I just need to scalar mult the previous potPubKey with the secret, right?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Or only do g2^secret without using the previous potPubKey?

author: plasmapower
content: hmm yeah I think the potPubKey should just be your pubkey, but I don't think this really matters, as the sequencer seems to always give you an initial potPubKey of one

author: plasmapower
plasmapower
content: I think the check that's failing is that `e(new_powers.g1[1], g2) != e(old_powers.g1[1], pot_pubkey)`

author: plasmapower
content: in other words you should generate the new powers by multiplying the old ones by your secret

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I thought I did that, I might have an issue with copying the scalar

author: plasmapower
content: Ah I think the issue is that scalar starts at your secret whereas perhaps it should start at one

author: plasmapower
plasmapower
content: my reading of the sequencer code is that it really starts at index one, in other words `x^1`

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: The &(*) doesn't copy, so we overwrite the same scalar

author: plasmapower
content: ah that might do it too

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I'll check in five minutes ;)

author: plasmapower
content: hah gl

author: plasmapower
content: If someone's around to review it I did make a PR to fix it https://github.com/ethereum/kzg-ceremony-sequencer/pull/151

author: plasmapower
content:
yep sure enough btw my go staticcheck is catching this:
> &*x will be simplified to x. It will not copy x. (SA4001)go-staticcheck

content: ah right I forgot go did this

content: so silly
